name: Jatropha
Relationship: Compare: CAMPH.; VERAT.; GAMBOGE.; CROTON.; JATROPHA URENS - Sponge-nettle - (oedema and cardiac paresis).
Modalities: Better: by placing hands in cold water

Stomach: Heat and burning in stomach, with crampy, constrictive pain in epigastrium
Nausea and vomiting, brought on by drinking, with acrid feeling from throat
Stool: Diarrhoea; forced discharge; loud noise in abdomen like gurgling of water coming out of a bung-hole, associated with coldness, cramps, nausea, and vomiting
Abdomen: Pain in region of liver and under right scapula to shoulder
Extremities: Cramps in muscles, especially calves, legs, and feet
Pain in ankles, feet and toes

details: Of value in cholera and diarrhoea. The abdominal symptoms are mot important. Suppressed measles (H. Farrington).
